page.title: 09East Hyde School Closure
page.content: In{July 1984,}the school bell at{East {Hyde J.M.I. School}rang for the last time. In the{September following,}the children transferred to{The Lea School in{Harpenden,}which is an open plan school about two miles away. This involved{twelve children}in all, who now travel to school by{coach. Most were{shocked and saddened}when they first heard about the change from their teacher. When they were interviewed{almost a {year}later, however,{nearly all}the children were{happy}at their new school. Although they{missed}their{teacher from{East Hyde,}they{appreciated having more{space, equipment and {books.}Practically all have made{new {friends}among the children already at {The Lea School.
